parts.name: OpenSprinkler Pi (OSPi)
parts.description: OpenSprinkler Pi (OSPi) is a sprinkler / irrigation extension board for Raspberry Pi (RPi). It allows RPi to directly access and control sprinkler valves. This is version 1.4 with OpenSprinkler injection molded enclosure. The built-in components include on-board 24V AC to 5V DC switching regulator, solenoid drivers, DS1307 RTC and battery, PCF8591T 8-bit A/D D/A converter (4 input and 1 output channels), fuse, rain sensor terminal, one general-purpose relay, and per-station transient voltage suppressor (bidirectional TVS).

parts.name: Ultrasonic Module HC-SR04 Distance Measuring Transducer Sensor For Arduino
parts.description:
Module main technical parameters:
1.Working Voltage : 5V(DC)
2.Static current: Less than 2mA.
 3.Output signal: Electric frequency signal, High Level 5V, Low Level 0V.
 4.Input trigger Signal: 10us TTL impulse
5.Echo Signal : output TTL PWL Signal
6. Trigger Pulse Input
7. Echo Pulse Output
Use method:
Supply module with 5V, the output will be 5V while obstacle in range, or 0V if not.The out pin of this module is used as a switching output when anti-theft module, and without the feet when ranging modules.
 Note : the module should be inserted in the circuit before been power, which avoid producing high level of misoperation;if not, then power again.
 Module Working Principle:
1.Adopt IO trigger through supplying at least 10us sequence of high level signal.
 2.The module automatically send eight 40khz square wave and automatically detect whether receive the returning pulse signal.
 3.If there is signals returning, through outputting high level and the time of high level continuing is the time of that from the ultrasonic transmitting to receiving. Test distance = (high level time * sound velocity (340M/S) / 2.
 
ote : This module is not suitable to connect with electric power, if you need to connect this module with electronic power,then let the GND terminal of this module to be connected first,otherwise, it will Affect the Normal work of the Module

parts.name: Addicore nRF24L01+ and ESP8266 Breadboard Adapter (BB-ADTR)

The BB-ADTR breadboard adapter makes it easy to connect any 2x4 pin device or module, such as the nRF24L01+ or ESP8266 ESP-01 modules, to a standard breadboard. The adapter has a wide enough footprint to secure the board and a connected module firmly to a breadboard, but is small enough to conserve breadboard real estate. Made of a quality 1.6mm thick FR4 industrial quality PCB board with the pads pre-tinned with a lead free HASL finish we made sure this little board would be durable and easy to solder. 

Adapter comes unassembled, requires soldering.

parts.name: Window or Door Contact Magnetic Reed Switch Alarm security electric sensor
parts.description: The reed switch is an electrical switch operated by an applied magnetic field. It was invented at Bell Telephone Laboratories in 1936 by W. B. Ellwood. It consists of a pair of contacts on ferrous metal reeds in a hermetically sealed glass envelope. There are two types of reed switches: 'normally open' reed switches and 'normally closed' reed switches. The metal reeds on a normally open switch stay open when there is no magnet near the switch. In the presence of a magnetic field, the contacts of a normally-open reed switch will close. A normally-closed reed switch is closed when it is not near a magnet; as a magnet is brought close to it, a normally-closed switch will open.

parts.name: Enc28j60 Network Adapter Module For Raspberry Pi Zero
parts.description:
1. Install the NIC module into the raspberry Pi.
 2. Connect the network cable to ensure that your router supports DHCP and works well.
 3.Burn the Raspbian image to TF card.
 4. Edit the /boot/config.txt file by your favorite editor such as 'Nano' or 'vim.tiny', and add the following parameter: 
 dtoverlay=enc28j60
 Then save the exit and reboot the raspberry Pi.

parts.name: Cluster HAT v2 for the Raspberry Pi
parts.description:
The Cluster HAT (Hardware Attached on Top) interfaces a (Controller) Raspberry Pi A+/B+/2/3 with (up to) 4 Raspberry Pi Zeros (1.1/1.2 or W) configured to use USB Gadget mode is an ideal tool for teaching or testing small scale clusters.
 
 USB Gadget Mode: Ethernet and Serial Console.
 Onboard 4 port USB 2.0 hub.
 Raspberry Pi Zeros powered via Controller Pi GPIO
 Individual Raspberry Pi Zero power controlled via Controller Pi GPIO (I2C).
 Connector for Controller Serial Console (our USB Serial Adaptor or a Sparkfun FTDI Basic).
 Controller Pi can be rebooted without interrupting power to Pi Zeros (network recovers on boot).
 The standard ClusterHAT package contains (Power supply/network cable/Raspberry Pi 3/Zeros not included):
 
 1x ClusterHAT PCB*
 4x 12mm M2.5 standoff
 8x 6mm M2.5 screw
 4x stick on foot
 USB Cable*

parts.name: 5X Breadboard Adapter PCB for ESP8266 ESP-01 ESP-01S Breakout Serial Wifi Module
parts.description:
This is a breadboard adapter for the popular ESP-01 ESP-01S
 As ESP-01/01S Pin arrangements are not breadboard friendly and are not labeled, which makes it little inconvenient for rapid prototyping.This breadboard adapter will help you to make prototyping with esp-01/01S module much more easier.
This breakout conveniently offers clear pinout silkprint on top and will nicely fit your prefered breadboard.
Last but not least, we added a 0.1µF decoupling capacitor so the ESP-01 will always run smoothly and without a hitch.
